title: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed, indicating the need to save the changes. However, the error message is not clear and does not provide guidance on how to save or discard the changes. The error message is titled 'Error' and includes quotes. The user is left to figure out the necessary steps to save or discard the changes.
OB: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed saying that the source page is dirty and that the changes need to be saved.
EB: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message should be displayed clearly indicating the need to save or discard the changes. The error message should not be titled 'Error' and should not include quotes.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor.
2. Switch to the 'source' view.
3. Edit the XML.
4. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
5. Verify that an error message is displayed clearly indicating the need to save or discard the changes.
